column4: If you're trying to act dumb, make sure not to capitalize the 'non-'proper noun.
if your going to try and insult me please try harder

i wasn't trying to insult you. i was pointing out that, despite your claims, you know what Windows is, and if you wish to play along as though you don't know what it is, say "I have windows in my wall..." instead of "I have Windows in my wall..."
you mean when I am referring to Windows and making a pun (or play) on the words , in that context ? how is England these days btw ?
normally tar -cf backup.tar /usr/local/pgsql/data will do it
maybe a diffrent place on mine then yours , grep for it
I was on another flavour on ssh, forgot it wasnt ubuntu : )
so if i backup /var/lib/postgresql/8.3/main i'm safe?
yes, though there are better ways to back it up which mean you can restore much faster if you need to make a clean install
i can't run the server, which is why i want to make a clean install
ouch : ( yeah back that folder up, then move it back on
best way is to backit up and make a clean same version install, move that daa folder out the way and cp over your backup, restart and do a pg_dump to rescue it
